author: CBR
description:
In this Heroes Journey Podcast clip, we cover how Star Trek: The Last Starship was designed as a gateway book for readers who never clicked with Star Trek. 

You don’t need decades of continuity, you just need to love great comics — and they promise the water’s warm!

🎙️ Clip from CBR’s Heroes Journey Podcast – Episode 9.

- Watch the full episode here: https://youtu.be/RRjvIuJBwhA
- More Heroes Journey Podcast episodes: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLfpipp6KbWs4apsUf5fIcxVw1cpaXXWxg

#StarTrek #Comic #CBR #TheLastStarship #SciFi #HeroesJourney #Podcast #Interview

title: Why Star Trek: The Last Starship is perfect for all fans, old and new 🚀 #StarTrek #Comic #CBR

author: CBR
description:
Supergirl trailer breakdown time! 
In Episode 10 of CBR’s Heroes Journey Podcast, Sean O’Connell and Sierra Nutkevitch react to the DCU’s first look at Kara Zor-El (Milly Alcock) and what this movie is going for.

We kick off with a live, first-watch Supergirl trailer breakdown and why the vibe feels “heavy Guardians”: punk attitude, Krypto trouble, and a Blondie “Call Me” needle-drop.

Then, we interview Tim Blake Nelson on where his love of comics began, what’s changed in the "machinery" of blockbuster filmmaking from The Incredible Hulk era to now, and why the theatrical experience still hits differently. He also digs into his novel Superhero, how his writing process works when the ending isn’t locked, and what he looks for when a story has to "stick the landing."

Chapters
00:18 – Supergirl Trailer Breakdown Setup: Milly Alcock’s Kara Zor-El in the DCU
02:19 – Supergirl Trailer First Watch: Live Reaction + “Woman of Tomorrow” Context
05:29 – NYC Trailer Event: James Gunn, Craig Gi
title: Supergirl Analysis & Tim Blake Nelson's Superhero Journey | Heroes Journey EP 10
